column4: I want to use these cool applications but they are for KDE, Isn't there a way to have only gnome but be able to run these programs without installing a whole other set of libraries?
if you install it from synaptic it should install the appropriate libriaries as well
I understand that synaptic will take care if it for me, but if I am using two different gui toolkits it uses a lot more ram
I just checked and it only has 4 dependencies, shoudlnT' be that bad
have you considered passepartout ?  XML-based Desktop Publishing Application
iptables is the userland tool for managing netfilter
netfilter is the part in the kernel
10 minutes seems a little long but yes cups takes a bit long to load up
and the cpu usage goes up to 100%
and I can't ever get pass the first page of the add printer wizard

I'm adding a printer rigth now, ( not realy but to test)  , cpu is as 100% while the database is loading ,  and ti takes a while, just be patient try turning off some other stuff to help reduce the load if you hve a lot of stuff running, could be a problem with your cmputer if you ar low on resources
i have amd 3200+ and 1GB of ram
I don'T know then , I'm just brain storming
